Articles.Content:
In my pre-release 1.1 career, I just completed a mission to orbit Minmus and return home with Val at the wheel of the lander can. I think I came across some sort of bug or something that made my vessel rotate uncontrollably faster and faster every time I EVA'd. While trying to collect the data from my science instruments, I had to use a combination of time-warp to stop the motion and hit B to board, otherwise I would be flung out of control. All this while the Martian music score is playing in the background. 

Long story short, it was a minute or two of high suspense and the music perfectly lined up. The song was the one that plays when Mark Watney is doing his Iron Man stunt to rendezvous with the Hermes. The suspense built, and then the happy part of the song played perfectly in line with me finally boarding my craft. It's the little things like that that make me love this game.
Pretty much the music got coincidentally starts and ends. Wow.

Yes. I can't tell you how many times my gameplay has lined up perfectly with my music playlist. I love it when that happens. I remember one time that the (explosive) landing of my prototype space shuttle lined up with the 2001 theme. And then I survived!
